segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes, completely unaware of the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is overflowing, and she’s just standing there, polishing that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the puddle growing at her feet, but she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The way she’s holding the dish towel, like she’s in her own little world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she’s going to be in for a big surprise when she finally looks down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The dishes next to her are stacked neatly, like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the water streaming down the cabinets, and she’s just ignoring it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The way she’s standing, it’s like she’s completely detached from everything else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll even realize what’s happening until it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The faucet is still running, and she’s just drying dishes like it’s any other day.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she turns around before the whole kitchen is flooded.
segments.speaker: PAR
